trans-unit.source: It's far too easy for someone to make adjustments to the HTML that allow them to bypass the validation, or to remove it entirely. It's also possible for someone to bypass your HTML and submit the data directly to your server.

It's important to understand why different media formats are needed for the web. For various reasons mostly outside the scope of this article, different browsers support different media formats. Also, the area of media formats on the Web has greatly suffered from patent law in many countries including the USA and EU countries. (The notes on patents in this article are provided as-is and without any warranty.) This article discusses the formats most relevant to the web, including support in browsers on both mobile and desktop.
trans-unit.target: 了解为什么网络需要不同的媒体格式是很重要的。由于各种原因,大多不在本文的讨论范围内,不同的浏览器支持不同的媒体格式。另外,在网络上的媒体格式领域,包括美国和欧盟国家在内的许多国家都受到了专利法的极大影响。(本文中关于专利的说明按现状提供,不作任何保证)。本文讨论的是与网络最相关的格式,包括在移动和桌面的浏览器中的支持。

trans-unit.source: Labels are needed to associate assistive text with an <input>. The <label> element provides explanatory information about a form field that is always appropriate (aside from any layout concerns you have). It's never a bad idea to use a <label> to explain what should be entered into an <input> or <textarea>.
Labels are not themselves directly associated with forms. They are only indirectly associated with forms through the controls with which they're associated.

trans-unit.source: Large amounts of interactive content — including buttons — placed in close visual proximity to each other should have space separating them. This spacing is beneficial for people who are experiencing motor control issues, who may accidentally activate the wrong interactive content.

Large amounts of interactive content—including anchors—placed in close visual proximity to each other should have space inserted to separate them. This spacing is beneficial for people who are experiencing motor control issues, who may accidentally activate the wrong interactive content while navigating.
trans-unit.target: 大量交互式内容（包括锚点）应放置在视觉上彼此靠近的位置，并应插入空格以将它们分开。此间距对于遇到运动控制问题的人员很有用，他们可能会在导航时意外激活错误的交互式内容。

trans-unit.source: Let's consider a quick example of selecting an appropriate color palette for a site. Imagine that you're building a web site for a new game that takes place on the planet Mars. So let's do a Google search for photos of Mars. Lots of good examples of Martian coloration there. We carefully avoid the mockups and the photos from movies. And we decide to use a photo taken by one of the Mars landers humanity has parked on the surface over the last few decades, since the game takes place on the planet's surface. We use a color picker tool to select a sample of the color we choose.
trans-unit.target: 让我们考虑一个为站点选择适当调色板的简单示例。想象一下，您正在为一个在火星上发生的新游戏建立一个网站。因此，让我们用Google搜索火星的照片。那里有许多很好的火星着色的例子。我们会仔细避免样机和电影中的照片。而且，我们决定使用过去几十年来人类在火星登陆器上拍摄的照片，因为该游戏是在地球表面进行的。我们使用颜色选择器工具选择我们选择的颜色的样本。

And we decide to use a photo taken by one of the Mars landers humanity has parked on the surface over the last few decades, since the game takes place on the planet's surface. We use a color picker tool to select a sample of the color we choose.

trans-unit.source: Like all other HTML elements, this element supports the global attributes, except that the dir attribute behaves differently than normal: it defaults to auto, meaning its value is never inherited from the parent element. This means that unless you specify a value of either "rtl" or "ltr" for dir, the user agent will determine the correct directionality to use based on the contents of the <bdi>.
trans-unit.target: 与所有其他HTML元素一样，此元素也支持全局属性，但 dir 属性的行为不同于常规属性：默认为 auto ，这意味着它的值永远不会从父元素继承。这意味着，除非指定任一值 "rtl" 或 "ltr" 用于 dir 中，用户代理将确定正确的方向性使用基于的内容 <bdi> 。

trans-unit.source: Like all other HTML elements, this element supports the global attributes, except that the dir attribute behaves differently than normal: it defaults to auto, meaning its value is never inherited from the parent element. This means that unless you specify a value of either rtl or ltr for dir, the user agent will determine the correct directionality to use based on the contents of the <bdi>.

trans-unit.source: Making the right choices when selecting colors when designing a web site can be a tricky process, especially if you aren't well-grounded in art, design, or at least basic color theory. The wrong color choice can render your site unattractive, or even worse, leave the content unreadable due to problems with contrast or conflicting colors. Worse still, if using the wrong colors can result in your content being outright unusable by people withcertain vision problems, particularly color blindness.
trans-unit.target: 在设计网站时,在选择颜色时做出正确的选择是一个棘手的过程,特别是如果你没有良好的艺术、设计或至少是基本的色彩理论基础。错误的颜色选择会使你的网站失去吸引力,甚至更糟糕的是,由于对比度或颜色冲突的问题,使内容无法阅读。更糟糕的是,如果使用了错误的颜色,可能会导致有视力问题的人,尤其是色盲,无法直接使用你的内容。

trans-unit.source: Microdata
trans-unit.target: Microdata

trans-unit.source: Microdata is part of the WHATWG HTML Standard and is used to nest metadata within existing content on web pages. Search engines and web crawlers can extract and process microdata from a web page and use it to provide a richer browsing experience for users. Search engines benefit greatly from direct access to this structured data because it allows search engines to understand the information on web pages and provide more relevant results to users. Microdata uses a supporting vocabulary to describe an item and name-value pairs to assign values to its properties. Microdata is an attempt to provide a simpler way of annotating HTML elements with machine-readable tags than the similar approaches of using RDFa and classic microformats.

Microdata is part of the WHATWG HTML Standard and is used to nest metadata within existing content on web pages.[1] Search engines, web crawlers, and browsers can extract and process microdata from a web page and use it to provide a richer browsing experience for users. Search engines benefit greatly from direct access to this structured data because it allows search engines to understand the information on web pages and provide more relevant results to users. Microdata uses a supporting vocabulary to describe an item and name-value pairs to assign values to its properties. Microdata is an attempt to provide a simpler way of annotating HTML elements with machine-readable tags than the similar approaches of using RDFa and microformats.
trans-unit.target: 微数据是WHATWG HTML标准的一部分，用于将元数据嵌套在网页上的现有内容中。[1]搜索引擎，网络搜寻器和浏览器可以从网页中提取和处理微数据，并使用它为用户提供更丰富的浏览体验。搜索引擎直接访问此结构化数据将极大地受益，因为它使搜索引擎能够理解网页上的信息并为用户提供更多相关的结果。微数据使用辅助词汇表来描述项目和名称/值对，以为其属性分配值。与使用RDFa和微格式的类似方法相比，微数据是一种尝试提供一种使用机器可读标签为HTML元素添加注释的简单方法。

trans-unit.source: Microdata vocabularies provide the semantics or meaning of an Item. Web developers can design a custom vocabulary or use vocabularies available on the web, such as the widely used schema.org vocabulary. A collection of commonly used markup vocabularies are provided by Schema.org.
trans-unit.target: 微数据词汇表提供了项目的语义或含义。Web开发人员可以设计自定义词汇表或使用Web上可用的词汇表，例如广泛使用的schema.org词汇表。Schema.org提供了一组常用的标记词汇。

trans-unit.source: Most notable here is the use of the -moz-appearance property (with prefixes needed to support some browsers). By default, radio buttons (and checkboxes) are styled with the operating system's native styles for those controls. By specifying appearance: none, you can remove the native styling altogether, and create your own styles for them. Here we've used a border along with border-radius and a transition to create a nice animating radio selection. Notice also how the :checked pseudo-class is used to specify the styles for the radio button's appearance when selected.
trans-unit.target: 这里最值得注意的是 -moz-appearance 属性的使用（带有支持某些浏览器所需的前缀）。默认情况下，单选按钮（和复选框）使用这些控件的操作系统本机样式设置样式。通过指定 appearance: none ，您可以完全删除本机样式，并为其创建自己的样式。在这里，我们使用了一个 border ，一个边框 border-radius 和一个 transition 来创建一个动画动画选择。还请注意 :checked ，：checked伪类如何用于指定单选按钮外观的样式。

trans-unit.source: Most of the CSS is unchanged. We do, however, add a slightly more subtle style for header cells contained directly within a <tbody> (as opposed to those which reside in a <thead>). This is used for the headers indicating each table section's corresponding major.
trans-unit.target: 大多数CSS保持不变。但是，我们确实为直接包含在 <tbody> 中的标头单元格添加了稍微微妙的样式（与那些驻留在 <thead> 中的标头单元格相反）。这用于指示每个表节的对应专业的标题。

trans-unit.source: Most of the time, IDL attributes will return their values as they are really used. For example, the default type for <input> elements is "text", so if you set input.type="foobar", the <input> element will be of type text (in the appearance and the behavior) but the "type" content attribute's value will be "foobar". However, the type IDL attribute will return the string "text".
trans-unit.target: 大多数情况下，IDL属性将返回其实际使用的值。例如，默认 type 为 <input> 元素为“文本”，因此，如果集 input.type="foobar" ，则 <input> 元素将是类型文本（在外观和行为），但“类型的内容属性的值将为“ foobar”。但是， type IDL属性将返回字符串“ text”。

trans-unit.source: Note that this doesn't have to be limited to images, or even files of the same type — think big! You could perhaps preload then display a simple SVG diagram if the user is on a narrow screen where bandwidth and CPU is potentially more limited, or preload a complex chunk of JavaScript then use it to render an interactive 3D model if the user's resources are more plentiful.

trans-unit.source: Note that this is not even close to an adequate filter for valid e-mail addresses; it would allow things such as " @beststartupever.com" (note the leading space) or "@@beststartupever.com", neither of which is valid. However, the browser runs both the standard e-mail address filter and our custom pattern against the specified text. As a result, we wind up with a validation which says "make sure this resembles a valid e-mail address, and if it is, make sure it's also a beststartupever.com address."
trans-unit.target: 请注意，对于有效的电子邮件地址，这甚至还远远不够。它将允许诸如“ @ beststartupever.com”（请注意前导空格）或“ @@ beststartupever.com”之类的东西都无效。但是，浏览器针对指定的文本运行标准的电子邮件地址过滤器和我们的自定义模式。结果，我们得到一个验证，验证结果为“确保该地址类似于有效的电子邮件地址，如果是，请确保它也是beststartupever.com地址。”

trans-unit.source: Note that when the user clicks the button, we remove the required attribute(s) from the input(s) we are hiding, and empty the value attribute(s). This is so that we can submit the form if both input sets aren't filled in, and won't submit data that we didn't mean to submit. If we didn't do this, you'd have to fill in both feet/inches and meters to submit the form!
trans-unit.target: 请注意，当用户单击按钮时，我们从隐藏的输入中删除了 required 属性，并清空了 value 属性。这样一来，如果两个输入集都未填写，我们就可以提交表单，并且不会提交我们本不想提交的数据。如果我们不这样做，则您必须填写英尺/英寸和米来提交表格！

trans-unit.source: Note that when you omit the hue's unit, it's assumed to be in degrees (deg).
trans-unit.target: 请注意，当您省略色相的单位时，会假定它以度（ deg ）为单位。

trans-unit.source: Note that writing balanced tags may cause other tags to be inferred in a way that makes the write unbalanced. E.g. <script>document.write("<div></div>");</script> inside the head element will be interpreted as <script>document.write("</head><body><div></div>");</script> which is unbalanced.
trans-unit.target: 请注意，写入平衡标签可能会导致其他标签被推断，从而导致写入不平衡。例如， head 元素内的 <script>document.write("<div></div>");</script> 将解释为 <script>document.write("</head><body><div></div>");</script> 不平衡。

trans-unit.source: Note the "Next" key in the lower-right corner of the keyboard.
trans-unit.target: 注意键盘右下角的 "下一步 "键。

trans-unit.source: Note the <abbr> element nested inside the <dfn>. The former establishes that the term is an abbreviation ("HST") and specifies the full term ("Hubble Space Telescope") in its title attribute. The latter indicates that the abbreviated term represents a term being defined.
trans-unit.target: 注意 <dfn> 内嵌套的 <abbr> 元素。前者确定该术语为缩写（“ HST”），并在其 title 属性中指定完整术语（“ Hubble Space Telescope”）。后者表示缩写术语代表所定义的术语。

trans-unit.source: Note the use of <span> to allow customization of the appearance of specific portions of the sample text such as the shell prompts and the cursor. Note also the use of <kbd> to represent the command the user entered at the prompt in the sample text.

trans-unit.source: Notice that when clicking on a radio button, there's a nice, smooth fade out/in effect as the two buttons change state. trans-unit.source: Now that you have a grey paint and a perfectly vivid color, you need to mix them together. The saturation (S) component of the color indicates what percentage of the final color should be comprised of that perfectly vivid color. The rest of the final color is made up of the grey paint that represents the saturation.
trans-unit.target: 现在,你已经有了一种灰色的颜料和一种完全鲜艳的颜色,你需要把它们混合在一起。颜色的饱和度(S)分量表示最终颜色中该完美鲜艳的颜色应占多大比例。最终颜色的其余部分是由代表饱和度的灰色颜料组成的。

trans-unit.source: Now that you know what CSS properties exist that let you apply color to elements and the formats you can use to describe colors, you can put this together to begin to make use of color. As you may have seen from the list under Things that can have color, there are plenty of things you can color with CSS. Let's look at this from two sides: using color within a stylesheet, and adding and changing color using JavaScript code to alter the styles of elements.
trans-unit.target: 现在您已经知道存在哪些CSS属性，可以将颜色应用于元素以及可以用来描述颜色的格式，接下来可以将它们放在一起以开始使用颜色。正如您可能在“ 可以具有颜色的事物” 下的列表中看到的那样，您可以使用CSS进行许多着色。让我们从两个方面看待这个问题：在样式表中使用color ，以及使用JavaScript代码添加和更改颜色以更改元素的样式。

trans-unit.source: Now we have our base color and our accent. On top of that, we have a few complementary shades of each, just in case we need them for gradients and the like. The colors can then be exported in a number of formats so you can make use of them.
trans-unit.target: 现在我们有了基础色和重点色。除此之外,我们还为每种颜色准备了一些互补色,以备我们在渐变等方面的需要。然后,这些颜色可以以多种格式导出,以便你可以利用它们。

trans-unit.source: Now we need some CSS. First is the CSS for the wrapper itself; this specifies the display mode and size we want so that the page lays out correctly; in essence, it's reserving an area of the page for the slider so that the rotated slider fits into the reserved space without making a mess of things.
trans-unit.target: 现在我们需要一些CSS。首先是包装器本身的CSS,它指定了我们想要的显示模式和大小,以便页面正确地排版;本质上,它是为滑块保留了页面的一个区域,以便旋转的滑块能够适应预留的空间,而不会弄得一团糟。

trans-unit.source: Now we'll go all-out, with styles on rows in the header and body areas both, including alternating row colors, cells with different colors depending on position within a row, and so forth.

trans-unit.source: On UTF-8 encoded pages, <wbr> behaves like the U+200B ZERO-WIDTH SPACE code point. trans-unit.source: Once all the files have been successfully retrieved, they are moved into the real offline cache automatically, and a cached event is sent to the applicationCache object. Since the document has already been loaded into the browser from the cache, the updated document will not be rendered until the document is reloaded (either manually or programatically).
trans-unit.target: 成功检索所有文件后，它们会自动移到真正的脱机缓存中，并且已 cached 事件将发送到 applicationCache 对象。由于该文档已经从缓存中加载到浏览器中，因此只有在重新加载文档后（手动或编程方式），才会呈现更新的文档。

trans-unit.source: Once you have decided on your base color, there are plenty of online tools that can help you build out a palette of appropriate colors to use along with your base color by applying color theory to your base color to determine appropriate added colors. Many of these tools also support viewing the colors filtered so you can see what they would look like to people with various forms of color blindness. See Color and accessibility for a brief explanation of why this matters.
trans-unit.target: 一旦确定了基础色，就会有很多在线工具可以通过将颜色理论应用于基础色来确定适当的添加颜色，从而帮助您构建适当的调色板以与基础色一起使用。这些工具中的许多工具还支持查看过滤后的颜色，因此您可以查看各种色盲形式的人看起来像什么。有关其重要性的简要说明，请参见颜色和可访问性。

trans-unit.source: Once you have these colors, you will probably still need to select appropriate neutral colors. Common design practice is to try to find the sweet spot where there's just enough contrast that the text is crisp and readable but not enough contrast to become harsh for the eyes. It's easy to go too far in one way or another so be sure to get feedback on your colors once you've selected them and have examples of them in use available. If the contrast is too low, your text will tend to be washed out by the background, leaving it unreadable, but if your contrast is too high, the user may find your site garish and unpleasant to look at.
trans-unit.target: 一旦你有了这些颜色,你可能还需要选择合适的中性色。通常的设计实践是试图找到一个甜蜜点,即有足够的对比度,使文字清晰可读,但又不至于对比度太大,让人觉得刺眼。这很容易在某一方面走得太远,所以一旦你选择了颜色,并且有了使用的例子,一定要得到反馈。如果对比度太低,你的文字往往会被背景冲淡,让人无法阅读,但如果你的对比度太高,用户可能会觉得你的网站很华丽,不好看。

trans-unit.source: One issue with number inputs is that their step size is 1 by default — if you try to enter a number with a decimal, such as "1.0", it will be considered invalid. If you want to enter a value that requires decimals, you'll need to reflect this in the step value (e.g. step="0.01" to allow decimals to two decimal places). Here's a simple example:

trans-unit.source: One issue with number inputs is that their step size is 1 by default. If you try to enter a number with a decimal (such as "1.0"), it will be considered invalid. If you want to enter a value that requires decimals, you'll need to reflect this in the step value (e.g. step="0.01" to allow decimals to two decimal places). Here's a simple example:
One nice feature of <link> elements is their ability to accept media attributes. These can accept media types or full-blown media queries, allowing you to do responsive preloading!
trans-unit.target: <link> 元素的一个不错的功能是它们能够接受 media 属性。这些可以接受媒体类型或成熟的媒体查询，从而使您能够进行响应式预加载！

One problem with search forms is their accessibility; a common design practice is not to provide a label for the search field (although there might be a magnifying glass icon or similar), as the purpose of a search form is normally fairly obvious for sighted users due to placement (this example shows a typical pattern).
trans-unit.target: 搜索表单的一个问题是它们的可访问性。常见的设计做法是不为搜索字段提供标签（尽管可能会有放大镜图标或类似图标），因为由于放置位置的原因，搜索表单的目的通常对视力正常的用户来说是相当明显的（此示例显示了模式）。

trans-unit.source: One property, "image", whose value is a URL
trans-unit.target: 一个属性 "image",其值是一个URL

trans-unit.source: One thing the datetime-local input type doesn't provide is a way to set the time zone and/or locale of the date/time control. This was available in the datetime input type, but this type is now obsolete, having been removed from the spec. The main reasons why this was removed are a lack of implementation in browsers, and concerns over the user interface/experience. It is easier to just have a control (or controls) for setting the date/time and then deal with the locale in a separate control.
trans-unit.target: datetime-local 输入类型不提供的一件事是设置日期/时间控件的时区和/或语言环境的方法。在 datetime 输入类型中可用，但是此类型已过时，已从规范中删除。删除此代码的主要原因是浏览器缺乏实现，以及对用户界面/体验的担忧。仅具有一个（或多个）控件来设置日期/时间，然后在单独的控件中处理语言环境会更容易。

trans-unit.source: One thing to note is that the displayed date and time formats differ from the actual value; the displayed date and time are formatted according to the user's locale as reported by their operating system, whereas the date/time value is always formatted "yyyy-MM-ddThh:mm". When the above value submitted to the server, for example, it will look like "partydate=2017-06-01T08:30".
trans-unit.target: 要注意的一件事是显示的日期和时间格式与实际 value 不同；所显示的日期和时间将根据其操作系统报告的用户区域设置进行格式化，而日期/时间 value 则始终采用 "yyyy-MM-ddThh:mm" 格式化。例如，当上述值提交给服务器时，它将看起来像 "partydate=2017-06-01T08:30" 。

trans-unit.source: One thing to note is that the displayed date and time formats differ from the actual value; the displayed date and time are formatted according to the user's locale as reported by their operating system, whereas the date/time value is always formatted yyyy-MM-ddThh:mm. When the above value submitted to the server, for example, it will look like partydate=2017-06-01T08:30.

One thing to note is that the displayed date format differs from the actual value — the displayed date format will be chosen based on the set locale of the user's browser, whereas the date value is always formatted yyyy-mm-dd.
trans-unit.target: 需要注意的一件事是，显示的日期格式与实际 value 不同-显示的日期格式将根据用户浏览器的设置区域设置进行选择，而日期 value 始终采用 yyyy-mm-dd 格式。

trans-unit.source: One thing to note is that the displayed date format differs from the actual value; most user agents display the month and year in a locale-appropriate form, based on the set locale of the user's operating system, whereas the date value is always formatted yyyy-MM.
trans-unit.target: 要注意的一件事是显示的日期格式与实际 value 不同；大多数用户代理会根据用户操作系统的设置区域设置以适合区域设置的形式显示月份和年份，而日期 value 始终采用 yyyy-MM 格式。

trans-unit.source: One thing to note is that the displayed format may differ from the actual value, which is always formatted yyyy-Www. When the above value is submitted to the server, for example, browsers may display it as Week 01, 2017, but the submitted value will always look like week=2017-W01.
trans-unit.target: 需要注意的一件事是，显示的格式可能与实际 value 有所不同，后者始终采用 yyyy-Www 格式。例如，当将上述值提交给服务器时，浏览器可能会将其显示为 Week 01, 2017 ，但是提交的值将始终看起来像 week=2017-W01 。

This subtag defines a dialect of the base language from a particular location, and is either 2 letters in ALLCAPS matching a country code, or 3 numbers matching a non-country area. For example, es-ES is for Spanish as spoken in Spain, and es-013 is Spanish as spoken in Central America. “International Spanish” would just be es.
trans-unit.target: 可选的。此子标签定义了特定位置的基本语言的方言，并且是与国家代码匹配的ALLCAPS中的2个字母，或与非国家区域匹配的3个数字。例如， es-ES 用于西班牙语，如在西班牙所说，而 es-013 是西班牙语在中美洲。“国际西班牙语”将是 es 。

trans-unit.source: Optional. This subtag defines the writing system used for the language, and is always 4 characters long, with the first letter capitalized. For example, French-in-Braille is fr-Brai and ja-Kana is Japanese written with the Katakana alphabet. If the language is written in a highly typical way, like English in the Latin alphabet, there is no need to use this subtag.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, <mark> indicates a portion of the document's content which is likely to be relevant to the user's current activity. This might be used, for example, to indicate the words that matched a search operation.
trans-unit.target: 否则， <mark> 指示文档内容的一部分，该部分可能与用户的当前活动有关。例如，这可以用于指示与搜索操作匹配的单词。

trans-unit.source: Our <form> contains one <input> of type email for the user's e-mail address, a <textarea> to enter their message for IT into, and an <input> of type "submit", which creates a button to submit the form. Each text entry box has a <label> associated with it to let the user know what's expected of them.
trans-unit.target: 我们的 <form> 包含一个用于输入用户电子邮件地址的类型为 email 的 <input> ，一个用于输入其IT消息的 <textarea> ，以及一个类型为 "submit" 的 <input> ，该按钮创建一个按钮来提交形成。每个文本输入框都有一个与之关联的 <label> ，以使用户知道对它们的期望。

Pages set with a refresh value run the risk of having the time interval being too short. People navigating with the aid of assistive technology such as a screen reader may be unable to read through and understand the page's content before being automatically redirected. The abrupt, unannounced updating of the page content may also be disorienting for people experiencing low vision conditions.
trans-unit.target: 设置了 refresh 值的页面存在时间间隔太短的风险。借助屏幕阅读器等辅助技术进行导航的人们在自动重定向之前可能无法阅读并理解页面的内容。页面内容的突然，未经通知的更新也可能使视力低下的人迷失方向。

trans-unit.source: Password input boxes generally work just like other textual input boxes; the main difference is the obscuring of the content to prevent people near the user from reading the password.

trans-unit.source: People experiencing low vision conditions and browsing with the aid of assistive technology such as a screen reader may not understand what the preformatted text characters are representing when they are read out in sequence.
trans-unit.target: 遇到低视力情况并借助辅助技术(如屏幕阅读器)进行浏览的人,在按顺序读出预先格式化的文本字符时,可能不明白这些字符代表什么。

trans-unit.source: People experiencing low vision conditions, navigating with the aid of screen reading technology, or with cognitive concerns may be confused when a new tab, window, or application opens unexpectedly. Older screen-reading software may not even announce the behavior.

People experiencing low vision conditions, who are navigating with the aid of screen reading technology, or who have cognitive concerns may become confused when the new tab, window, or application is opened unexpectedly. Older versions of screen reading software may not even announce the behavior.
trans-unit.target: 当新标签、窗口或应用程序意外打开时,视力低下的人、借助屏幕阅读技术进行导航的人或有认知问题的人可能会感到困惑。旧版本的屏幕阅读软件可能甚至不会宣布这种行为。

trans-unit.source: People navigating with the aid of assistive technology such as a screen reader can use the value of a title attribute declared on an iframe to determine what embedded content it contains. The title's value should concisely describe the embedded content.

trans-unit.source: Per the HTML specification, the default style for <summary> elements includes display: list-item. This makes it possible to change or remove the icon displayed as the disclosure widget next to the label from the default, which is typically a triangle.

Prior to 75, Firefox accepted any CSS media (MIME) type, with optional parameters. Starting in 75, this has been restricted to the string 'text/css', per the spec.
Prior to Firefox 11, neither Tools -> Clear Recent History nor Tools -> Options -> Advanced -> Network -> Offline data -> Clear Now cleared the offline cache. This has been fixed.
trans-unit.target: 在Firefox 11之前，“工具”->“清除最近的历史记录”或“工具”->“选项”->“高级”->“网络”->“脱机数据”->“立即清除”均未清除脱机缓存。此问题已解决。

trans-unit.source: Prior to Firefox 14, the <progress> element was incorrectly classified as a form element, and therefore had a form attribute. This has been fixed.
trans-unit.target: 在Firefox 14之前， <progress> 元素被错误地分类为form元素，因此具有 form 属性。此问题已解决。

trans-unit.source: Prior to Firefox 4, Firefox also supported the middle, absmiddle, and abscenter values as synonyms of center, in quirks mode only.
trans-unit.target: 在Firefox 4之前，Firefox 仅在怪癖模式下还支持将 middle ， absmiddle 和 abscenter 值作为 center 的同义词。

trans-unit.source: Prior to Firefox 6, a <canvas> element with a zero width or height would be rendered as if it had default dimensions.
trans-unit.target: 在Firefox 6之前，宽度或高度为零的<canvas>元素将呈现为默认尺寸。

trans-unit.source: Prior to Firefox 63, rel="noopener" created windows with all features disabled by default. Starting with Firefox 63, these windows have the same features enabled by default as any other window.
trans-unit.target: 在Firefox 63之前， rel="noopener" 创建的窗口默认禁用所有功能。从Firefox 63开始，这些窗口默认情况下具有与其他任何窗口相同的功能。

trans-unit.source: Prior to Firefox 83 the crossorigin attribute was not supported for rel="icon" there is also an open issue for Chrome.

Prior to the release of Safari 13, the contentinfolandmark role was not properly exposed by VoiceOver. If needing to support legacy Safari browsers, add role="contentinfo" to the footer element to ensure the landmark will be properly exposed.

trans-unit.source: Providing a lang attribute with a valid IETF identifying language tag on the <html> element will help screen reading technology determine the proper language to announce. The identifying language tag should describe the language used by the majority of the content of the page. Without it, screen readers will typically default to the operating system's set language, which may cause mispronunciations.

Providing a lang attribute with a valid IETF identifying language tag on the html element will help screen reading technology determine the proper language to announce. The identifying language tag should describe the language used by the majority of the content of the page. Without it, screen readers will typically default to the operating system's set language, which may cause mispronunciations.
trans-unit.target: 在 html 元素上为 lang 属性提供有效的IETF标识语言标签，将有助于屏幕阅读技术确定要宣布的正确语言。标识语言标签应描述页面大部分内容使用的语言。如果没有它，屏幕阅读器通常会默认使用操作系统的设置语言，这可能会导致错误发音。

trans-unit.source: RFC 1866: HTML 2.0

RGB (Red/Green/Blue) functional notation, like hexadecimal string notation, represents colors using their red, green, and blue components (as well as, optionally, an alpha channel component for opacity). However, instead of using a string, the color is defined using the CSS function rgb(). This function accepts as its input parameters the values of the red, green, and blue components and an optional fourth parameter, the value for the alpha channel.
trans-unit.target: RGB（红色/绿色/蓝色）功能符号类似于十六进制字符串符号，使用它们的红色，绿色和蓝色分量（以及可选的不透明度的alpha通道分量）表示颜色。但是，可以使用CSS函数 rgb() 来定义颜色，而不是使用字符串。该函数接受红色，绿色和蓝色分量的值以及可选的第四个参数（alpha通道的值）作为其输入参数。

trans-unit.source: Reading currentTime returns a double-precision floating-point value indicating the current playback position of the media specified in seconds. If the media has not started playing yet, the time offset at which it will begin is returned. Setting currentTime sets the current playback position to the given time and seeks the media to that position if the media is currently loaded.

Reading currentTime returns a double-precision floating-point value indicating the current playback position, in seconds, of the audio. If the audio's metadata isn't available yet—thereby preventing you from knowing the media's start time or duration—currentTime instead indicates, and can be used to change, the time at which playback will begin. Otherwise, setting currentTime sets the current playback position to the given time and seeks the media to that position if the media is currently loaded.

trans-unit.source: Script access to a frame's content is subject to the same-origin policy. Scripts cannot access most properties in other window objects if the script was loaded from a different origin, including scripts inside a frame accessing the frame's parent. Cross-origin communication can be achieved using Window.postMessage().

trans-unit.source: Scripts trying to access a frame's content are subject to the same-origin policy, and cannot access most of the properties in the other window object if it was loaded from a different domain. This also applies to a script inside a frame trying to access its parent window. Cross-domain communication can still be achieved using Window.postMessage().
trans-unit.target: 试图访问框架内容的脚本受制于同源策略，并且如果该窗口对象是从其他域加载的，则无法访问该窗口对象中的大多数属性。这也适用于试图访问其父窗口的框架内的脚本。仍然可以使用 Window.postMessage() 实现跨域通信。

trans-unit.source: Scripts with the defer attribute will execute in the order in which they appear in the document.
Scripts with the defer attribute will prevent the DOMContentLoaded event from firing until the script has loaded and finished evaluating.
Scripts with the defer attribute will prevent the DOMContentLoaded event from firing until the script has loaded and finished evaluating.
trans-unit.target: 带有defer属性的脚本将阻止DOMContentLoaded事件的发生,直到脚本已经加载并完成评估。

trans-unit.source: Scripts without async , defer or type="module" attributes, as well as inline scripts, are fetched and executed immediately, before the browser continues to parse the page.

trans-unit.source: Search engines typically display about the first 55–60 characters of a page title. Text beyond that may be lost, so try not to have titles longer than that. If you must use a longer title, make sure the important parts come earlier and that nothing critical is in the part of the title that is likely to be dropped.

trans-unit.source: Second, in the url input we set pattern to ".*\.myco\..*". This simple regular expression requests a string that has any number of characters, followed by a dot, followed by "myco", followed by a dot, followed by any number of characters. And because the browser runs both the standard URL filter and our custom pattern against the specified text, we wind up with a validation which says "make sure this is a valid URL, and also in a Myco domain."
trans-unit.target: 其次，在 url 输入中，将 pattern 设置为 ".*\.myco\..*" 。这个简单的正则表达式请求一个字符串，该字符串包含任意数量的字符，后跟一个点，后跟“ myco”，然后是一个点，后跟任意数量的字符。并且由于浏览器针对指定的文本同时运行标准URL过滤器和我们的自定义模式，因此我们得到了一个验证，表明“确保这是有效的URL，并且在Myco域中”。
